Transparent Tiles

Tiles do not have to be opaque. We can have transparent shapes that sit on top of other tiles. I have included a tree as an example. You can find it in Included Files | TutorialResources | Photoshop | TransparentTree.psd . If you can't find it you can locate the file in the browser (or click here).

Now go copy and paste the tree into spr_background_tiles.psd but make sure it has no background (delete any pixels in the 64 by 64 quadrant you are placing it in). It should look like:

Export it one last time as a PNG file. Then import it into spr_background_tiles.

Open rm_lvl_test_3 and add another Tile Layer and call it Transparent_Tiles and put it inbetween Instances and Tiles_Animation.

Sprinkle some trees around the level.

Run the game by pressing the Play Button. You should see trees on top of the other layer. This is all we will do with tiles for now! Next chapter we will look at character animation.
